articles.title: Mozambique Begins Hearing into Police’s role in Post-Election Violence and Killings
articles.content:
Click to expand Image Police fired tear gas during a nationwide strike called by Mozambique presidential candidate Venancio Mondlane to protest the provisional results of an October 9 election, in Maputo, Mozambique, October 21, 2024. © 2024 Siphiwe Sibeko/Reuters

On July 7, the former commander-general of the Mozambican police, Bernardino Rafael, whom the President dismissed in January 2025, appeared before the Office of the Attorney General (Procuradoria-Geral da República) for a hearing about the police’s involvement in the killing of about 400 people during the civil unrest that followed last year’s elections.

The attorney general had already announced the opening of 31 criminal proceedings against members of the Mozambican police implicated in the violent repression of those postelection protests.

The protests erupted in response to allegations of electoral fraud and were led by opposition candidate Venâncio Mondlane. They lasted for more than four months. Civil society organizations, including Plataforma Decide, estimate that approximately 400 demonstrators were shot dead and about 600 injured as a result of excessive police force. A previous Human Rights Watch report documented the killings of at least 10 prominent opposition party officials from October 2024 to March 2025.

Human Rights Watch has previously documented how the police used excessive force against protesters, including by indiscriminately firing tear gas and using rubber bullets and live ammunitions, sometimes in residential areas. In a case we documented in November 2024, a mother was preparing lunch for her 5-year-old son when her house was filled with teargas which the police were using to disperse the protesters.

The Attorney General’s Office has stated that the proceedings’ aim is to establish criminal responsibility of those responsible for unlawful abuses.

While the hearing has not yet resulted in formal charges or precautionary measures, the Mozambican government taking concrete steps to address police violence, launching multiple investigations, and hearing the testimony of senior figures is a step in the right direction for the national inclusive dialogue, which was established to discuss constitutional and political reforms following the postelection violence in October 2024. Although still in preliminary stages, these proceedings reinforce Mozambique’s stated commitment to justice and accountability for human rights violations.

To ensure that this process delivers, the government should ensure it remains independent and impartial, and that those responsible for serious violations are criminally charged. It should also embark on urgently needed security sector reforms and trainings that would bring it into better alignment with national and international standards regarding regulating peaceful protests.
articles.reasoning: While the article discusses serious past violence and human rights abuses, the focus is on the government's steps toward accountability, justice, and reform, which represent progress and hope for positive change in Mozambique.
articles.personality_title: Mozambique takes important steps toward justice after election violence
articles.personality_presentation:
**Context**
After Mozambique’s tense 2024 elections, violent protests led to tragic losses, with hundreds hurt or killed amid claims of police abuse.

**What happened**
The former police chief, Bernardino Rafael, was recently questioned about the police’s role in these events, as the government opened investigations into officers involved in the crackdown.

**Impact**
This marks a hopeful move toward accountability, showing the government is serious about addressing past wrongs and protecting human rights.

**What's next**
Mozambique plans to continue these investigations fairly and work on reforms to prevent future violence and better respect peaceful protests.

**One-sentence takeaway**
Mozambique’s new efforts to uncover the truth and push for reform bring hope for a safer, fairer future for all its citizens.
articles.personality_title_fr: Le Mozambique prend des mesures importantes en faveur de la justice après les violences électorales
articles.personality_presentation_fr:
**Contexte**
Après les élections tendues de 2024 au Mozambique, des manifestations violentes ont conduit à des pertes tragiques, des centaines de personnes ayant été blessées ou tuées sur fond d'allégations d'abus de la part de la police.

**Ce qui s'est passé**
L'ancien chef de la police, Bernardino Rafael, a récemment été interrogé sur le rôle de la police dans ces événements, alors que le gouvernement a ouvert des enquêtes sur les officiers impliqués dans la répression.

**Impact**
Il s'agit là d'un pas encourageant vers la responsabilisation, qui montre que le gouvernement est sérieux dans sa volonté de réparer les erreurs du passé et de protéger les droits de l'homme.

**Et maintenant**
Le Mozambique prévoit de poursuivre ces enquêtes de manière équitable et de travailler sur des réformes visant à prévenir les violences futures et à mieux respecter les manifestations pacifiques.

**En une phrase**
Les nouveaux efforts déployés par le Mozambique pour découvrir la vérité et faire avancer les réformes permettent d'espérer un avenir plus sûr et plus équitable pour tous ses citoyens.
articles.personality_title_es: Mozambique da pasos importantes hacia la justicia tras la violencia electoral
articles.personality_presentation_es:
**Contexto**
Tras las tensas elecciones de 2024 en Mozambique, las violentas protestas provocaron trágicas pérdidas, con cientos de heridos o muertos en medio de denuncias de abusos policiales.

**Lo que ocurrió**
El ex jefe de policía, Bernardino Rafael, fue interrogado recientemente sobre el papel de la policía en estos sucesos, mientras el gobierno abría investigaciones sobre los agentes implicados en la represión.

**Impacto**
Se trata de un paso esperanzador hacia la rendición de cuentas, que demuestra que el gobierno se toma en serio la resolución de los errores del pasado y la protección de los derechos humanos.

**Próximos pasos**
Mozambique tiene previsto continuar estas investigaciones con imparcialidad y trabajar en reformas para prevenir futuros actos de violencia y respetar mejor las protestas pacíficas.

**Una frase para llevar a casa**
Los nuevos esfuerzos de Mozambique por esclarecer la verdad e impulsar reformas permiten albergar esperanzas de un futuro más seguro y justo para todos sus ciudadanos.
